pageContext.claim: “@RepDebDingell, who called me, tears flowing, to thank me for rolling out the maximum 'Red Carpet' for the funeral of her husband, then voted against me on the partisan Impeachment Hoax.”
pageContext.analysis: Rep. Debbie Dingell (D-Mich.), who succeeded her late husband in Congress, said she didn't call Trump. “He called me to tell me he was lowering the flags,” she said. “And that meant a lot. But John Dingell earned his burial at Arlington Cemetery because he’s a World War II veteran.” Trump also implied that he arranged for Dingell to lie in state in the Capitol Rotunda, but Dingell did not lie in state there (and such decisions are left to congressional leaders, not the president).
